profile_data.summary:
I am interested in building web applications and math/data science tools that solve highly impact problems.
In my free time and solve Leetcode, study, and work on personal projects.
This is my website: https://buibitsandbytes.onrender.com/
profile_data.headline: Data Scientist

experience.description:
• Achieved 1st Place Globally in Data Intelligence, recognized as the most prestigious data science award within Publicis Groupe worldwide.
• Won 1st Place in the Catalyst Award (Centralized Data Category), earning the opportunity to travel to New York for an exclusive interview with the CTO at CBS Studios.
• Played a key role in developing ROAI, an analytics suite integrating LLM and statistical tools, contributing to 50% of the application within a team of 8. The suite is used by 100+ analysts internally and has helped secure contracts with global enterprises clients.
• Resolved key challenges in ad offer analysis, search performance, KPI benchmarking, and spend optimization.
• Built 7 end-to-end machine learning applications using Python Dash, Javascript, and React, leveraging advanced statistical tools such as gradient boosting, random forests, power regression, Pyomo for non-linear optimization, and LLM models.
• Deployed applications on a weekly basis using Git, TeamCity, AWS S3, EFS, CloudFormation, and ECS, ensuring seamless integration and high reliability.
• Engaged in weekly discussions with senior management to explore and analyze the latest trends in generative AI
experience.title: Data Science Manager

experience.description: Created contents on various topics in machine learning, statistics, math, and data visualization
experience.title: Data Science Author

experience.description:
• Utilized time series and neural network models to predict drilling measurements, leading to substantial cost savings by decreasing the need for expensive logging tools.
• Served as the primary author for the publication ”Machine Learning Applications to Improve Pore Pressure Prediction in Hazardous Drilling Environments”
• Designed and implemented a data cleaning pipeline to standardize training data, ensuring the accuracy and reliability of predictive models.
• Managed the real-time deployment of the XGBoost model and implemented effective data versioning practices to maintain data integrity and traceability.
experience.title: Data Scientist

experience.description: Taught Python, Matlab, Calculus I, II, and Discrete Mathematics for 300+ engineer students
experience.title: Teaching Assistant

honors.description:
Every year, there are millions of auto accidents happen in the U.S. They do not only affect the drivers but also a long line of traffic behind them and waste thousands of hours. The accident happens due to various reason which includes but not limited to weather, bad roads, reckless driving, driving during night time, or breaking the speed limit. Our project analyzes the 3 years of data of all the accidents that happened in the US and helps State Farm connect the dots between the cause and effect the accidents. Learn more about it here:
https://devpost.com/software/get-a-quote-7nabd2
honors.title: Leader of 3rd place team at TamuHack 2020

honors.description:
Glasstire is the oldest online-only art magazine in the country publishing articles and reviews on all Texas-based art venues and events since 2001. Basically they are a living-breathing digital record of the Texas visual art community. Our project leveraging the rich functionality of Python and Tableau to find insight into the Glass tire dataset. Our main findings are:
Event Concentration by Zipcode, Number of Events by month/year/day/venues, Artist Activity, and the relationship between art venues and high-income families. You can find more about it here:
https://github.com/williamhuybui/Art-Events-in-Houston-Glasstire-Competition
honors.title: Leader of 1st Place Team at Glasstire DataHack, Rice University

projects.description:
• Used sale dataset from 2011-2016 to predict food, hobbies, and household products demand in the next 2 weeks
• Extracted insight and answers questions about trend, seasonality, and demand distribution across 10 stores
• Examined different time series forecasting techniques on 60 million observations based on their RMSE
projects.title: Forecasting Walmart’s Demand

projects.description:
• Investigating 2000 oil Pipeline Incidents from 2010 to 2017 through statistics and visualization
• Found that equipment failure causes more than 53% of the revenue loss
• Created the XGBoost model on the ConocoPhilips sensors data to detect the oil drill failure 
• Achieved 0.99383 F1-score
projects.title: Rolling In the Deep

projects.description:
Predicting Early Childhood Learning Outcome through PBS Kids
• Reduced 11 million observations to 14 thousand by strategically grouping, aggregating, and cleaning the data
• Developed the LGBM regression model that optimized the result for classification output.
• Generated 800+ from 11 features and used SVMSMOTE to handle imbalanced classes
• Obtained top 13% on Kaggle leaderboard
projects.title: Predicting Early Childhood Learning Outcome through PBS Kids

projects.description:
•  Analyzed 79 different features of housing data to gain insight using descriptive statistics and Tableau
•  Handled missing data, filtered noises, experimented with different encoding schemes, and removed overfitting features
•  Hyper-tuned and blended 6 models: Ridge, Lasso, ElasticNet, SVR, LightGBM, and XGBoost models
•  Reached top 7% on Kaggle leaderboard by the time submitted
projects.title: Iowa Ames House Price Prediction Using Advanced Regression

projects.description:
•  Queried 10 different tables using SQLite with more than 200,000-course section and 3 million grades
•  Applied hypothesis testing to validate the different statistical hypothesis
•  Answered 4 questions regarding or related to university instructor, day of the class, major, and GPA relationships
projects.title: The University of Wisconsin - Madison Grade Analysis

projects.description:
+ Obtained highest-grossing movies data from 2009 to 2019 through API Request and Web Scraping from IMDb
+ Applied descriptive statistics to detect outlier and understand confounding factors behind a movie, such as a sequel planning, leadership failure, and digital technology that influenced the revenue
+ Answered business questions regarding genre, rating, MPAA, date released, and actors and visualized them using Tableau
projects.title: Blockbuster Movie Trends
